availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Moores (Estill County, Kentucky laborer and soldier)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William J. Moores and Milly Moores. Resident of Estill County, Kentucky in 1850. Laborer in Estill County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as third sergeant, first sergeant, second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain from October 9, 1861 to August 17, 1865. Prisoner of war from July 30, 1864 to January 17, 1865. Mustered out of service on August 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 94A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 267.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 187.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #9189951, Certificate #685180.
Find A Grave, "CPT James Alexander Moores (1838-1909)," Memorial #26495947, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26495947 (accessed August 4, 2020).
